CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Enhanced π-π interactions in p - type donor polymers could improve their chargetransport ability , and thus increase short - circuit currents in solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Enhanced π-π interactions: This refers to the strengthening of the interaction between the aromatic rings (π systems) of certain molecules. The "π-π interactions" is the material name or type of interaction mentioned in the paragraph.
2. p-type donor polymers: These are polymers that can donate electrons. The "p-type" refers to the type of conductivity these materials exhibit, and "donor polymers" is the type of material. So, "p-type donor polymers" is the material name.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| p-type donor polymers |
| π-π interactions |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Enhanced π-π interactions in p - type donor polymers could improve their chargetransport ability , and thus increase short - circuit currents in solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Enhanced π-π interactions: This refers to the strengthening of the interaction between the aromatic rings (π systems) of neighboring molecules in p-type donor polymers.
2. p-type donor polymers: These are polymers that have the ability to donate electrons.
3. chargetransport ability: This refers to the ability of a material to transport electrical charge.
4. short-circuit currents: This is the maximum current that can flow through a solar cell under short-circuit conditions.
5. solar cells: These are devices that convert sunlight into electricity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Enhanced π-π interactions: This refers to the strengthening of the interaction between the aromatic rings (π systems) in p-type donor polymers.
2. chargetransport ability: This refers to the ability of p-type donor polymers to transport electrical charge.
3. short-circuit currents: This is the maximum electrical current that can flow through a solar cell under short-circuit conditions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Enhanced π-π interactions between aromatic rings (π systems) in p-type donor polymers |
| chargetransport ability of p-type donor polymers |
| short-circuit currents in solar cells |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Enhanced π-π interactions in p - type donor polymers could improve their chargetransport ability , and thus increase short - circuit currents in solar cells.

Let's think step by step.

1. Enhanced π-π interactions: This refers to the strengthening of the electronic interactions between the aromatic rings (π systems) in p-type donor polymers. It is a property related to the molecular structure and electronic behavior of the polymer.
2. Charge transport ability: This is a property that describes how efficiently charges (electrons or holes) can move through a material. In this context, it refers to the ability of p-type donor polymers to transport charges, which is crucial for their performance in solar cells.
3. Short-circuit currents: This is an electrical property of solar cells, specifically the maximum current that can be generated under short-circuit conditions. Improving the charge transport ability of p-type donor polymers can lead to increased short-circuit currents in solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Charge transport ability of p-type donor polymers
2. Short-circuit currents in solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                                   |
|----------------------------------------------|
| Charge transport ability of p-type donor polymers |
| Short-circuit currents in solar cells         |
